headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Ends Lower As Traders Slash Rate-Cut Bets; Nvidia Holds To $5 Trillion Mark
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average finished in the red in Wednesday's mixed close after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said there's no certainty of another 2025 cut in interest rates.  Nvidia, however, held to higher ground in the stock market today, locking its place as Wall Street's first company to close with a $5 trillion valuation.  The chip designer's shares rose ahead of earnings reports from three fellow Magnificent Seven companies.

content.title: Stock Market Today: Dow Ends Lower As Traders Slash Rate-Cut Bets; Nvidia Holds To $5 Trillion Mark
content.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average finished in the red in Wednesday's mixed close after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said there's no certainty of another 2025 cut in interest rates.  Nvidia, however, held to higher ground in the stock market today, locking its place as Wall Street's first company to close with a $5 trillion valuation.  The chip designer's shares rose ahead of earnings reports from three fellow Magnificent Seven companies.

headline: Verizon Earnings Beat, Revenue Misses. New CEO Promises Big Changes.
summary: Verizon Communications on Wednesday reported third-quarter adjusted earnings that topped Wall Street targets while revenue missed amid its sudden change in chief executives.  Verizon stock rose on the news.  The telecom firm continued to lose wireless subscriber market share amid intensified competition but added more postpaid phone subscribers overall than expected.

content.title: Verizon Earnings Beat, Revenue Misses. New CEO Promises Big Changes.
content.summary: Verizon Communications on Wednesday reported third-quarter adjusted earnings that topped Wall Street targets while revenue missed amid its sudden change in chief executives.  Verizon stock rose on the news.  The telecom firm continued to lose wireless subscriber market share amid intensified competition but added more postpaid phone subscribers overall than expected.

headline: Verizon Stock Jumps Despite Drop in Crucial Phone Subscribers
summary: Verizon Communications lost a net 7,000 postpaid phone connections last quarter, missing expectations that it would add a net 19,000 connections.  It is the third consecutive quarter of such losses, though they have been narrowing.  Dan Schulman, Verizon’s new CEO, said Verizon will aggressively reduce its costs and push to attract new customers.

content.title: Verizon Stock Jumps Despite Drop in Crucial Phone Subscribers
content.summary: Verizon Communications lost a net 7,000 postpaid phone connections last quarter, missing expectations that it would add a net 19,000 connections.  It is the third consecutive quarter of such losses, though they have been narrowing.  Dan Schulman, Verizon’s new CEO, said Verizon will aggressively reduce its costs and push to attract new customers.

headline: Verizon Shares Up 4.6% After Earnings But Growth Is Concerning
summary: Verizon Communications (NYSE: VZ) reported Q3 earnings that fell short on revenue and with a slight beat on earnings per share, and the stock is moving higher pre-market. Revenue came in at $33.82 billion, missing the $35.31 billion estimate by $1.49 billion. EPS landed at $1.21, beating by $0.02 the $1.19 consensus. Where the Strength ... headline: AI data centers boost Caterpillar earnings, Fiserv stock plunges
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Verizon Communications (VZ) stock gaining in pre-market trading on its latest earnings results and growth plan outlook, AI data center projects giving a boost to Caterpillar's (CAT) earnings, and Fiserv (FI) shares plunging after cutting its full-year profit forecast. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Verizon (NYSE:VZ) Misses Q3 Revenue Estimates
summary: Telecommunications giant Verizon (NYSE:VZ) fell short of the markets revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025 as sales only rose 1.5% year on year to $33.82 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.21 per share was 1.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Verizon (NYSE:VZ) Misses Q3 Revenue Estimates
content.summary: Telecommunications giant Verizon (NYSE:VZ) fell short of the markets revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025 as sales only rose 1.5% year on year to $33.82 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.21 per share was 1.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Verizon: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: NEW YORK (AP) — Verizon Communications Inc. VZ) on Wednesday reported third-quarter earnings of $4.95 billion. The New York-based company said it had net income of $1.17 per share.

content.title: Verizon: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: NEW YORK (AP) — Verizon Communications Inc. VZ) on Wednesday reported third-quarter earnings of $4.95 billion. The New York-based company said it had net income of $1.17 per share.

headline: Verizon tops estimates for subscriber additions, profit on strong phone upgrades
summary: (Reuters) -Verizon beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit and wireless subscriber additions on Wednesday, as promotions around the recent iPhone launches helped the U.S. wireless service provider attract more customers.  The company added 44,000 total monthly bill-paying wireless subscribers in the third quarter, compared with expectations for 19,000 additions, according to data from FactSet.  The results could ease investor concerns that Verizon is losing ground to rivals T-Mobile, AT&T and low-cost cable providers.

content.title: Verizon tops estimates for subscriber additions, profit on strong phone upgrades
content.summary: (Reuters) -Verizon beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly profit and wireless subscriber additions on Wednesday, as promotions around the recent iPhone launches helped the U.S. wireless service provider attract more customers.  The company added 44,000 total monthly bill-paying wireless subscribers in the third quarter, compared with expectations for 19,000 additions, according to data from FactSet.  The results could ease investor concerns that Verizon is losing ground to rivals T-Mobile, AT&T and low-cost cable providers.

headline: Trump-Xi Meeting, Microsoft Earnings, Fed Rate Decision: Still to Come This Week
summary: President Trump is poised to meet with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, following constructive weekend trade talks between Washington and Beijing. Investors will also tune into earnings from Apple, Amazon and Microsoft, plus the first Federal Reserve policy-setting meeting since the government shutdown began.
